data.title: Beacon of Justice Award
data.meta_description: NLADA’s Beacon of Justice Awards honor members of the pro bono legal community who are tireless advocates for equal justice.
data.text:
NLADA’s Beacon of Justice Awards honor members of the pro bono legal community who are tireless advocates for equal justice.

The 2024 Beacon of Justice Awards features law firms addressing issues related to CIVIL & HUMAN RIGHTS, for example, work with Afghan refugees, death penalty work, and resentencing of individuals as juveniles to life without parole. For more information on this year’s criteria click HERE. Click HERE to watch the Beacon of Justice presentation and click HERE to watch the full outline of awardees’ winning projects.

NLADA is pleased to announce that 40 firms were honored with the 2024 Beacon of Justice Award.

The 2024 Beacon Award honorees include Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, Arnold & Porter LLP, BakerHostetler LLP, Baker McKenzie, Beveridge & Diamond PC, Cravath, Swaine & Moore LLP, Crowell & Moring LLP, Dechert LLP, Dentons US LLP, DLA Piper LLP (US), Dorsey & Whitney LLP, Fried Frank LLP, Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP, Hanson Bridgett LLP, Hunton Andrews Kurth LLP, Husch Blackwell, Jackson Lewis PC, Jenner & Block LLP, King & Spalding LLP, Kirkland & Ellis LLP, Latham & Watkins LLP, Lowenstein Sandler LLP, McDermott Will & Emery LLP, Mintz Levin Cohn Ferris Glovsky and Popeo P.C., Nelson Mullins Riley & Scarborough LLP, Nixon Peabody LLP, Paul Hastings LLP, Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison LLP, Reed Smith LLP, Shook Hardy & Bacon LLP, Skadden Arps Slate Meagher & Flom LLP, Squire Patton Boggs (US) LLP, Steptoe LLP, Stinson LLP, Troutman Pepper LLP, Wiley Rein LLP, WilmerHale, Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, Yetter Coleman LLP, and Zuckerman Spaeder LLP.

Previous Beacon of Justice themes include:

LGBTG+ rights and/or gender-based equity issues

Work to address systemic racial disparities

Pro Bono programs serving vulnerable people fleeing to the U.S. border

Expanding opportunities for the underserved in areas such as education, health care, housing, and legal services

Have innovative Public-Private Partnerships that Protect Equal Justice for All through Appellate Litigation

Made a Significant Impact in the Area of Immigration

Represented Disadvantaged Families in Foreclosure Proceedings

Representation to People on Death Row

Representation to Detainees at Guantanamo Bay

View the 2024 Beacon of Justice Book

Past Award Winners by Year

The 2022 Beacon of Justice Awards honors law firms with pro bono programs whose work addressed racial inequities within their communities and/or on the national level in 2021.

Check out the digital book highlighting their work.
